Name: Republic Day
Description: A national holiday in India, celebrated on January 26 every year to commemorate the day when the Constitution of India came into effect in 1950.

Name: Valentine's Day
Description: A day observed globally as a celebration of love and affection among romantic partners, friends, and family members.

Name: Holi
Description: A Hindu festival celebrated in India and Nepal, known as the 'festival of colors' or 'festival of love', to signify the victory of good over evil and the arrival of spring.

Name: Mahavir Jayanti
Description: A Jain festival celebrated to honor the birth anniversary of Lord Mahavira, the last and 24th Tirthankara (enlightened being) of Jainism.

Name: Good Friday
Description: A Christian holiday commemorating the crucifixion and death of Jesus Christ, observed on the Friday before Easter Sunday.

Name: Biju Festival
Description: A festival celebrated by the Kondh tribe in the Indian state of Odisha to mark the beginning of the agricultural season and seek blessings for a good harvest.

Name: May Day
Description: A public holiday celebrated globally as International Workers' Day, to commemorate the social and economic achievements of the labor movement.

Name: Father's Day
Description: Honoring fathers and father figures, expressing gratitude for their love, support, and guidance.

Name: Guru Purnima
Description: Paying homage to teachers, seeking blessings for wisdom and knowledge.

Name: Independence Day
Description: Celebrating India's independence from British rule in 1947.

Name: Labor Day
Description: Honoring the contributions and achievements of workers.

Name: Muharram
Description: Commemorating the martyrdom of Imam Hussain and his companions.

Name: Mahatma Gandhi Jayanti
Description: Celebrating the birth anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi, the Father of the Nation.

Name: Dussehra
Description: Marking the victory of good over evil and the end of Navratri.

Name: Karva Chauth
Description: Fasting day for married women for the longevity and well-being of their husbands.

Name: Naraka Chaturdashi
Description: Celebrating the victory of Lord Krishna over the demon Narakasura.

Name: Diwali
Description: Festival of lights, symbolizing the triumph of light over darkness and knowledge over ignorance.

Name: Govardhan Puja
Description: Honoring Lord Krishna's lifting of the Govardhan Hill to protect his people from Indra's wrath.

Name: Bhai Dooj
Description: Celebrating the bond between brothers and sisters, and praying for their well-being.

Name: Guru Nanak Jayanti
Description: Celebrating the birth anniversary of Guru Nanak, the founder of Sikhism.

Name: Christmas
Description: Celebrating the birth of Jesus Christ.
